plugins.name: 쉽게 UX Writing Editor
plugins.description:
Write easy to use EasyUX - Makes it easy to create UX writing

It is possible to create UX Writing easily based on mass words data in business even personal.


Features

  1. Elaborating your sentences with given “alternative expressions”, correct spelling and proper grammar depending on your own massive data,
  2. Polishing sentences based on your business specific data.
  3. Changing literal style with 5 types.
  4. Creating a paragraph just giving 3 keywords


Learn more detail about the EasyUX features at https://twominutes.co.kr

To use tutorial versions of EasyUX, visit https://www.easyux.kr/


쉽게 - 쓰는 경험, 읽는 경험을 모두 쉽게 만들어 주는 UX라이팅 에디터

쉽게는 기업이 고객 대상으로 일관성있는 글쓰기를 하도록 돕는 데이터 기반 프로그램입니다.


기능

  1. '금지어'를 설정하고 '대체어'를 추천해 100명이 써도 한 명이 쓴 것처럼 회사의 글쓰기를 일관성있게 검토해요.
  2. 문장을 회사별 데이터를 기반으로 한 번에 다듬어요.
  3. 동일한 문장을 상황에 따라 5가지 톤앤매너로 바꿀 수 있어요.
  4. 키워드 3개만 쓰면 마케팅 문구 초안을 작성해요.


위에서 설명한 기능을 써 볼 수 있어요.https://www.easyux.kr/

UX라이팅 에디터 '쉽게'가 궁금하다면 https://twominutes.co.kr 방문해 보세요.
plugins.tagline: Write easy to use EasyUX - Makes it easy to create UX writing

plugins.name: Customer Journey Map Generator for FigJam（カスタマージャーニーマップジェネレーター）
plugins.description:
このプラグインを使えば、AIを活用してカスタマージャーニーマップを簡単に作成できます。

※2025年2月7日現在、プレビュー版です。

ご利用には Gemini APIのAPIキー が必要です。


---


できること


以下の内容を入力し、「生成」ボタンを押すだけで、カスタマージャーニーマップを自動作成できます。

  1. プロジェクト）
  2. ペルソナ
  3. ステージ
  4. タッチポイント


---


使い方


  1. Gemini API からAPIキーを取得します。
  2. プロジェクト、ペルソナ、ステージ、タッチポイントを入力します。
  3. 「生成」ボタンをクリック
  4. 生成されたジャーニーマップを確認し、必要に応じて編集できます。


カスタマージャーニーの可視化を、より手軽に！
plugins.tagline: Generate a Customer Journey Map with AI!

plugins.name: Replacing Colors
plugins.description: Replacing Colors is a powerful plugin that allows you to mass-replace colors in your Figma layouts with a single click. Easily transform the color scheme of your designs without the hassle of manually updating each element. Perfect for designers looking to streamline their workflow and maintain consistency across their projects. Simply select your target color, choose the replacement, and let the plugin do the rest. Compatible with various design styles and themes.

plugins.name: Ad Lib(s)
plugins.description:
Find out if your library components are used, in a list of design files.


1. How does it work? 


  1. First, go to your Figma settings and get a personal access token (aka a key which enables you, and only you, to communicate with your files),
  2. Then, copy / paste the links of both the library and the design files you want to inspect (those are the same links you use when your share a file, using the "Share" button)
  3. After a while, you should then see a list of all instances found in your design file, which components are used, and which aren't. You can click on a component, in order to locate it in your library file (to do so, you must launch this plugin in your library file)


2. Notes 


  • Please note that your personal token won't be shared or used in any way.
  • This plugin doesn't modify anything in your design (it only inspects, nothing more)
  • You need to be a least a member of a Team, otherwise you can't really use librairies, and this plugin won't be useful
  • All the files you can inspect must be created by you, or come from a Team you're a member of
  • The bigger the files, the longer you'll have to wait ! So, please be patient sometimes :)


If you find bugs, possible improvements, please feel free to contact me.

1. How does it work?

  2. Then, copy / paste the links of both the library and the design files you want to inspect (those are the same links you use when your share a file, using the "Share" button)
  3. After a while, you should then see a list of all instances found in your design file, which components are used, and which aren't. You can click on a component, in order to locate it in your library file (to do so, you must launch this plugin in your library file)

  • All the files you can inspect must be created by you, or come from a Team you're a member of
  • The bigger the files, the longer you'll have to wait ! So, please be patient sometimes :)


If you find bugs, possible improvements, please feel free to contact me.

plugins.name: Palette lap
plugins.description:
[From.Red]

This Figma plugin leverages OKLCH and APCA color system to automatically generate color palettes for your designs. Take the guesswork out of color coordination and easily get professional, theory-based palettes.


Usage:

  1. Set the Hue - not just red, any hue can be used
  2. Adjust Chroma - 0.5 is max saturation, try 0.01 for muted neutrals
  3. Name the color Variables with custom token names


Result:

  1. Generate 0/1/2/3...97/98/99/100 levels
  2. Generate variables, like "palette/hero/50"
plugins.tagline: Generate Harmonious Color Palettes  based on OKLCH and APCA.

116274.name: Palette lap
116274.description:
[From.Red]

This Figma plugin leverages OKLCH and APCA color system to automatically generate color palettes for your designs. Take the guesswork out of color coordination and easily get professional, theory-based palettes.

  2. Adjust Chroma - 0.5 is max saturation, try 0.01 for muted neutrals
  3. Name the color Variables with custom token names


Result:

  2. Generate variables, like "palette/hero/50"
116274.tagline: Generate Harmonious Color Palettes  based on OKLCH and APCA.

plugins.name: Frame Generator
plugins.description:
Frame Generator simplifies the process of creating responsive design frames for web and mobile layouts directly in Figma. With just a click, this plugin generates three frames—Desktop, Tablet, and Mobile—complete with predefined grid layouts to match standard design practices.


Key Features:

  1. Automatically generates frames for Desktop (1440px), Tablet (768px), and Mobile (375px) sizes.
  2. Pre-configured grid layouts for each frame, ensuring consistency and alignment.
  3. Customizable spacing and columns for flexible design systems.
  4. Streamlines your workflow for responsive design projects.


Perfect for designers who need to quickly create responsive layouts without manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Create Desktop, Tablet & Mobile Base Layout

114149.name: Frame Generator
114149.description:
Frame Generator simplifies the process of creating responsive design frames for web and mobile layouts directly in Figma. With just a click, this plugin generates three frames—Desktop, Tablet, and Mobile—complete with predefined grid layouts to match standard design practices.


Key Features:

  1. Automatically generates frames for Desktop (1440px), Tablet (768px), and Mobile (375px) sizes.
  2. Pre-configured grid layouts for each frame, ensuring consistency and alignment.
  3. Customizable spacing and columns for flexible design systems.
  4. Streamlines your workflow for responsive design projects.


Perfect for designers who need to quickly create responsive layouts without manual adjustments.
114149.tagline: Create Desktop, Tablet & Mobile Base Layout

plugins.name: Label Text to Frame Name
plugins.description: There is a check box, once you click the check box it will create a text field outside the frame which will associate to the frame name. It is a one time activity. Now you can use google sheet sync plugin to update the text field content dynamically and then Label to Frame Name plugin to update label text to Frame name.

plugins.name: Copy text with HTML tags
plugins.description:
How to get started?

Open the plugin and select a text box in your Figma file. Then, watch the text in the plugin window transform into semantically tagged text ready to be copied into your code editor.


Multiple styles supported

Currently the plugin supports bold, italic and underlined text styles. Note: Font weights such as SemiBold and Black will not be picked up as bold by this plugin. 


Plus... line breaks

There is also the ability replace line breaks with the <br> tag.


Only use the tags right for your project

You have the ability to customise your experience - simply select ‘Show options’ and select/deselect the formatting conditions appropriate for your project.


New addition - Color!

You can now get the in-line styling for text colors. Note that this segment of text will be added to a span, and the most common color in the selection will not be considered 'special' and therefore will be ignored.


New addition - Links!

Links will now be surfaced through this plugin, using <a href=""> syntax.


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

☕️ If you love this plugin and would like to support me, you can buy me a coffee at: https://buymeacoffee.com/figmargaux
plugins.tagline: Easily transform Figma text into plug-and-play styled text for your next project's code base

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

☕️ If you love this plugin and would like to support me, you can buy me a coffee at: https://buymeacoffee.com/figmargaux
109216.release_notes: Added tags for links & text colors (note: colors ignores the most common color of text in your selection, e.g. if all red then no color tags will be added)
109216.tagline: Easily transform Figma text into plug-and-play styled text for your next project's code base

plugins.name: Bueno Drops
plugins.description:
Bueno Drops is the easiest way to turn your artworks into digital collectibles (NFTs) in under a minute, all without needing to write a single line of code. With just a few clicks, you can convert your artboards into digital art, tickets, memberships, or digital gifts.


🧑‍🎨 For creators of all levels!

Whether you're a seasoned artist or just starting out, our plugin simplifies the entire process so you can focus on what you do best – creating!


♾️ Choose your ideal drop type

  • Open Edition: Drop your collectibles with ease and confidence, featuring an unlimited supply and a scheduled end date.
  • Limited Edition: Add an extra layer of uniqueness to your drops with a fixed number of redeemable collectibles.


👾 Why Bueno Drops?

It's a new way to monetize your art, build a loyal community, and showcase your unique style.


Connect with us

✏️ Learn the ropes on YouTube

🖤 Questions & feedback: hi@bueno.art

🔗 bueno.art

accepted.name: Pablo Stanley
accepted.description: Artist at Bueno, Humankind, and Robotos

plugins.tagline: Bueno Drops is the easiest way to turn your artworks into digital collectibles.

plugins.name: Gemma
plugins.description:
Introducing Gemma


Gemma is the personal assistant you've been looking for to solve all your design needs. No more endless hours searching for the perfect images or struggling with copywriting. With a huge library of resources, Gemma is always just a conversation away. It's super easy to use and feels like you're having a conversation with a real person. Gemma is also an expert in copywriting. With a simple command, you can check your copy for errors and get suggestions for improvements. One of the coolest things about Gemma is that it learns from you. As you use the plugin, Gemma learns your preferences and adapts to your style. It's like having a personal assistant who knows exactly what you need and how you work. Trust us, try Gemma today and you'll get unlimited wishes and a new best friend to help you with all your design needs.
plugins.tagline: The AI design assistant

52985.description:

With a huge library of resources, Gemma is always just a conversation away. It's super easy to use and feels like you're having a conversation with a real person. Gemma is also an expert in copywriting. With a simple command, you can check your copy for errors and get suggestions for improvements. One of the coolest things about Gemma is that it learns from you. As you use the plugin, Gemma learns your preferences and adapts to your style. It's like having a personal assistant who knows exactly what you need and how you work. Trust us, try Gemma today and you'll get unlimited wishes and a new best friend to help you with all your design needs.

plugins.name: Redact
plugins.description:
Redact is your go-to Figma plugin for transforming text into clean, minimalist blocks, perfect for low-fidelity wireframes and abstract design concepts. It takes paragraphs, headlines, or any text, and replaces them with rectangles styled to match the original dimensions and colour. Whether you're prototyping or creating quick concepts, Redact helps you focus on structure over details, letting your ideas shine without the clutter of words. With built-in support for multi-line paragraphs and auto-layout integration, it’s the perfect tool to streamline your design process. Simplify your designs—block by block!


Please note that Redact is designed to run without a user interface. It performs its function immediately when activated. If no selection is made, it notifies the user to select a frame or group.
plugins.tagline: Texts to blocks, the low-fi hack!

110399.name: Redact
110399.description:
Redact is your go-to Figma plugin for transforming text into clean, minimalist blocks, perfect for low-fidelity wireframes and abstract design concepts. It takes paragraphs, headlines, or any text, and replaces them with rectangles styled to match the original dimensions and colour. Whether you're prototyping or creating quick concepts, Redact helps you focus on structure over details, letting your ideas shine without the clutter of words. With built-in support for multi-line paragraphs and auto-layout integration, it’s the perfect tool to streamline your design process. Simplify your designs—block by block!


Please note that Redact is designed to run without a user interface. It performs its function immediately when activated. If no selection is made, it notifies the user to select a frame or group.
110399.tagline: Texts to blocks, the low-fi hack!

plugins.name: Design Review
plugins.description: Design Review provides quick, detailed feedback on UI designs. It analyzes key aspects like visual hierarchy and usability, highlighting strengths and areas for improvement. Users upload a UI frame, receive expert feedback, and can immediately improve their designs. This tool is useful for both new and experienced designers, helping to save time, improve design quality, and teach best practices in UI design.
plugins.tagline: Review design using Gemini

plugins.name: Cassini Copilot
plugins.description:
This is Cassini’s creator plugin.


Pushing work to Cassini

Designers using Figma can push their designs into their Cassini account with this plugin, without having to leave their creator spaces.


Pulling visual references from Cassini

While working on Figma designers can pull in views they (or their team) have collected in Cassini inside their respective sets.
plugins.tagline: Get Design Assistance within Figma

85097.name: Cassini Copilot
85097.description:
This is Cassini’s creator plugin.


Pushing work to Cassini

Designers using Figma can push their designs into their Cassini account with this plugin, without having to leave their creator spaces.


Pulling visual references from Cassini

While working on Figma designers can pull in views they (or their team) have collected in Cassini inside their respective sets.

plugins.name: orgaNICE! - Organize & label everything into sections!
plugins.description:
orgaNICE is a simple but powerful plugin that helps you structure your Figma files by creating clean, consistent section containers for your designs with automatic header labels for each selected item in a single click!


Pretty NICE for designers who want to maintain an organized and professional workspace!


Support this project - Thanks :)


How It Works:

  1. Select the items you wish to organize
  2. Open orgaNICE! plugin
  3. Add a section title
  4. Press Organize and done!


Features:

  1. ⚡ Quick Clean-up: Create organized sections for any item with a single click


  1. 🎨 Color Presets: Save and reuse custom colors for background and header text


  1. 🔠 Layout options: Select between horizontal, vertical & wrap layout for the output section


  1. 💾 Settings Persistence: Simple stuff, basically keeps the last used settings as the default setting to make your life easier


  1. 🅰️ Header Text: Automatically add header titles to each frame with customizable text size and color


  1. 👥 Settings Sharing: Copy and paste settings between team members for consistent styling across projects


Perfect for design teams who want to establish and maintain organizational standards across projects and team members.
plugins.tagline: Arrange frames, componets, sections, images, etc into a customisation section

130226.name: orgaNICE! - Organize & label everything into sections!
130226.description:
orgaNICE is a simple but powerful plugin that helps you structure your Figma files by creating clean, consistent section containers for your designs with automatic header labels for each selected item in a single click!


Pretty NICE for designers who want to maintain an organized and professional workspace!


Support this project - Thanks :)


How It Works:

  1. Select the items you wish to organize
  2. Open orgaNICE! plugin
  3. Add a section title
  4. Press Organize and done!


Features:

  1. ⚡ Quick Clean-up: Create organized sections for any item with a single click


  1. 🎨 Color Presets: Save and reuse custom colors for background and header text


  1. 🔠 Layout options: Select between horizontal, vertical & wrap layout for the output section


  1. 💾 Settings Persistence: Simple stuff, basically keeps the last used settings as the default setting to make your life easier


  1. 🅰️ Header Text: Automatically add header titles to each frame with customizable text size and color


  1. 👥 Settings Sharing: Copy and paste settings between team members for consistent styling across projects


Perfect for design teams who want to establish and maintain organizational standards across projects and team members.

manifest.name: orgaNICE! - Organize frames, components & more with one click!

130226.release_notes: - Added theme support to Plugin UI. Now you can use in Light mode!
130226.tagline: Arrange frames, componets, sections, images, etc into a customisation section

plugins.description: Keep your design projects organized and transparent with this plugin. This handy tool helps you create Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) right inside your Figma files. plugins.name: Layer Renamer
plugins.description:
Hello, I am a designer. In my work, I often need to rename different product components with specified product numbers. Manually doing this is a massive task, so I used AI to develop this plugin (I have no coding skills). You can input multiple names directly into the plugin's input field or copy multiple names from Excel or other text tools and paste them into the input field. Names should be separated by spaces. This allows you to batch rename the selected layers in order.


How to Use:

· Open the plugin in Figma.

· Enter or paste the desired layer names in the input field.

· Select the layers you want to rename in Figma.

· Click the "Rename Layers" button to apply the new names.


Limitations:

· Ensure the number of names matches the number of selected layers to avoid naming errors.

· The renaming order follows the layer hierarchy from bottom to top.

· The plugin automatically removes special characters not supported in Windows file names during renaming.

· Save your work before batch renaming to prevent any unintended changes.
plugins.tagline: Rename selected layers using input names to boost workflow efficiency

plugins.name: FigmaCardify
plugins.description:
Introducing FigmaCardify, the lightning-fast postcard component library designed specifically for social media apps like Twitter. With FigmaCardify, building eye-catching media cards has never been easier. Choose from a curated selection of pre-built card variations, each optimized to showcase your media content flawlessly.


Efficiency is at the core of FigmaCardify. Toggle effortlessly between light and dark modes to match the aesthetic of your social media platform. Quickly adjust the number of images to suit your needs, ensuring your cards capture attention with the perfect visual balance.


Our plugin empowers you to streamline your design process, saving valuable time while delivering professional-quality results. Simply select your desired card variant, drop in your media, and watch as FigmaCardify magically assembles a beautifully composed layout.


Whether you're promoting a new product, sharing captivating visuals, or engaging with your audience, FigmaCardify offers an intuitive interface that lets you create stunning media cards with ease. Leave a lasting impression on your Twitter followers with visually appealing and on-brand content.


Unlock the power of efficient design and elevate your social media presence with FigmaCardify. Get started today and experience the speed and simplicity of crafting striking media cards that stand out on Twitter.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly design stunning postcards with time-saving layouts.

plugins.name: Alwan
plugins.description:
About Alwan

Alwan is your custom controlled random color generator.You can use Alwan to control what range of colors to apply randomly on selected elements. Effortlessly apply dynamic colors to selected elements with custom HSL Range values.


Features

Customize, Select, Apply!

  • Apply random colors to fills and strokes of selected elements.
  • Choose and control on what to apply from a variety of element types

- All : All elements selected (Including Group children)

- Rectangles : All rectangles selected

- Ellipses : All ellipses selected

- Polygons : All polygons selected

- Stars : All stars selected.

Text : All texts selected


  • Customize HSL ranges to control the color spectrum.
  • Instantly apply random colors with a single click.
  • Choose a HSL Preset to apply on selected elements.


Alwan streamlines the color design process, adding an element of spontaneity to your Figma workflow.


Instructions


Color Range

  • If you want to manually customize the color range than in the Custom Tab
  1. Customize Hue, Saturation & Lightness ranges using the sliders or manually input the values.
  2. Setup your Target Preferences.
  3. Click “Apply on x selected elements”.


  • If you want to use one of the Range Presets
  1. Choose which preset you want to apply Full Spectrum, Vibrant, Neon, Pastel, Light & Dark Colors.
  2. Setup your Target Preferences.
  3. Click “Apply on x selected elements”.


Target Preferences

  • Define where to apply colors : Fills / Strokes
  • Define the element type you want to be affected by the random colors.


Please note: If you did not set a certain range for the colors, the plugin will automatically apply the full range for Hue, Saturation & Lightness. 


Experiment with different settings to discover new color combinations.


You can reach me out for feedback and bug reports at hello@brahimr.com or via my personal contact form at https://brahimr.com/contact.


Thank you and happy randomizing!
plugins.tagline: Apply random colors to fills and strokes of selected elements within a custom HSL range.

plugins.name: Bulk Desaturate: Black & White Image Fills
plugins.description:
Description

Bulk Desaturate makes it easy to convert image fills to black and white in Figma — instantly and non-destructively. Whether you're testing tone, removing visual noise, or creating grayscale wireframes, this plugin simplifies your workflow.


How to use

  1. Select images or shapes containing image fills
  2. Choose a style
  3. Convert images


Features

  1. Supports multiple selections
  2. One-click “Select All” image fills
  3. Non-destructive fill layering
  4. Optimized grayscale presets
  5. Fast and lightweight — ideal for large files


How it works

Bulk Desaturate adds a black and white version of the original image as a new fill layer inside each selected shape. Your original image stays intact underneath, so changes are non-destructive. You can easily remove the grayscale fill by removing this new layer — or just press Undo (Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z) to go back instantly.


Each style (Muted, Neutral, Punchy) applies a different contrast and exposure setting, so you can match the grayscale look to your design’s mood or testing needs.


Feature requests and feedback

I have plans to make this better and make bulk image editing much easier. While I am working on that, hit me on X (@itssumeetp), via mail (itssumeetp@gmail.com), or leave a comment here.
plugins.tagline: Instantly select all images and convert to black and white. Apply grayscale styles in bulk.

plugins.name: Multiple font resizer
plugins.description:
Multiple font resizer


This plugin allows you to easily adjust the size of selected text elements.

You can increase or decrease the font size by the amount you assign with just one click.


Instructions for use:

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Run the plugin and choose whether you want to increase or decrease the font size.
  3. The plugin will automatically adjust the size and load the necessary fonts.


Recommendation: For better results, it's recommended to select only text elements, avoiding the selection of "groups" or "frames" (that contain text).


Warning: This plugin is in beta, which means it may not work perfectly in all cases.


By Nicolás Agüero.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly adjust the size of multiple text elements to your preferred value with a single click

plugins.name: Image Alt Text Generator
plugins.description:
Alt Text Generator for Figma


This plugin helps you automatically generate alt text for images in your Figma designs, enhancing accessibility and user experience. It can generate alt text for individual images, multiple images, or all images on the page at once. The images are converted into Components, and the generated alt text is stored in the description field of each image. Developers can easily access this alt text in Dev Mode for seamless integration into code.


Note: Requires an OpenAI API Key for alt text generation. You can sign up and get your API key at OpenAI.
plugins.tagline: Automatically generate alt text for images

113201.name: Image Alt Text Generator
113201.description:
Alt Text Generator for Figma


This plugin helps you automatically generate alt text for images in your Figma designs, enhancing accessibility and user experience. It can generate alt text for individual images, multiple images, or all images on the page at once. The images are converted into Components, and the generated alt text is stored in the description field of each image. Developers can easily access this alt text in Dev Mode for seamless integration into code.


Note: Requires an OpenAI API Key for alt text generation. You can sign up and get your API key at OpenAI.
113201.release_notes: Settings, UI updates, and bug fixes
113201.tagline: Automatically generate alt text for images

plugins.name: HSL ShadesBR
plugins.description:
- This plugin utilizes the HSL method to create shades, tints and neutral color palettes based on a selected color. It also generates color styles automatically.

- Generates shades and tints based on the selected color creating harmonious color variations. This saves time and effort for designers while promoting visual consistency and facilitating creativity in exploring different color schemes.

- Generates a neutral palette adjusted to harmonize with the base color instead of using standard neutral colors. This approach can add depth and richness to the overall color palette while ensuring that the neutrals blend seamlessly with the other colors used in the design.

- Automatically creates styles with the generated colors expediting the design process and ensuring consistency throughout the project.

- Intuitive and user-friendly interface.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly generate harmonized color variations and styles.

88383.description:

- Generates a neutral palette adjusted to harmonize with the base color instead of using standard neutral colors. This approach can add depth and richness to the overall color palette while ensuring that the neutrals blend seamlessly with the other colors used in the design.

- Automatically creates styles with the generated colors expediting the design process and ensuring consistency throughout the project.

- Intuitive and user-friendly interface.
88383.tagline: Effortlessly generate harmonized color variations and styles.

plugins.name: Doist Utilities
plugins.description:
A plugin of utility functions for use with the Doist marketing design system.


It's unlikely that this plugin will be that useful to you since the color styles and components it references are specific to the Doist brand design system, but feel free to try it out anyway!


Utility functions:

  • set node to parent width/height/both
  • apply basic screenshot styles to image or frame
  • format monochromatic illustrations to be tintable with fills
  • show/hide annotation components
  • resize spacing component using the Brand spacing scale
  • create and name slices for icon export
  • append language codes to frames created by the Transifex plugin
  • Replace text with skeleton shapes

accepted.name: Doist
accepted.description: Designing a better way to work and live with Todoist and Twist.

plugins.name: Tokeno
plugins.description:
Overview:

Tokeno is a versatile Figma plugin designed to streamline the conversion of local variables into usable code snippets. With Tokeno, designers can effortlessly extract variable names and their corresponding values from Figma's local variables collection. The plugin then transforms this data into JSON format, offering seamless integration with development workflows. Moreover, Tokeno facilitates the conversion of JSON data into TypeScript (ts) and SCSS files, optimizing the transfer of design tokens into code.


Key Features:

  1. Local Variable Extraction: Tokeno simplifies the process of gathering variable names and values directly from Figma's local variables collection.
  2. JSON Conversion: The extracted data is automatically formatted into JSON, ensuring compatibility and ease of use across different platforms and environments.
  3. Code Generation: Tokeno empowers users to effortlessly convert JSON data into TypeScript (ts) and SCSS files, streamlining the transition of design tokens into development-ready code.


User Interface:

Tokeno boasts an intuitive user interface featuring two prominent buttons:

  1. Download TS: This button enables users to instantly download the generated TypeScript (ts) file containing the extracted local variables in a structured format.
  2. Download SCSS: With a single click, users can download the generated SCSS file, facilitating seamless integration of design tokens into SCSS-based projects.
plugins.tagline: Tokeno: Bridging Design and Code Seamlessly.

plugins.name: HCT Palette
plugins.description:
Create accessible color palettes for your design system in no time, with the help of HCT, a perceptual uniform color space.


How to Use:

  1. Input Your Base Color: Enter a color in HEX, RGB, or HSL format, and the plugin will automatically generate the corresponding HCT color.
  2. Name Your Palette: Give your palette a descriptive name such as “primary,” “success,” or “danger.”
  3. Customize Tones: The tool generates tones from 0 to 100 by default, in increments of 10. To add custom tones, simply input the desired value and press enter.
  4. Remove Tones: Hover over any tone and click the “X” to remove it from the palette.
  5. Add to Canvas: Click the "Add to Canvas" button to place the color palette directly onto your Figma canvas.
  6. Add to Variables: Click the "Add to Variables" button to add the colors palette as Figma's variables.


Check out the article Building an Accessible Color System to learn more about creating and refining color palettes, and building an accessible color system out of it.


HCT Color Space:

HCT (Hue, Chroma, Tone) is a perceptually uniform color space developed by Google. It combines the CAM16 model for hue and chroma with the CIELAB (D65) color space's tone (lightness), ensuring consistent visual representation across hues. By converting complex contrast ratios into simple tonal differences, HCT makes it easy to meet accessibility standards—just select colors with enough tonal contrast!


Explore More on HCT:

  1. The Science Behind HCT and Color Design
  2. Handbook of Color Psychology
plugins.tagline: Generate accessible color palettes instantly with HCT color space.

106201.description:

  2. Name Your Palette: Give your palette a descriptive name such as “primary,” “success,” or “danger.”
  3. Customize Tones: The tool generates tones from 0 to 100 by default, in increments of 10. To add custom tones, simply input the desired value and press enter.
  4. Remove Tones: Hover over any tone and click the “X” to remove it from the palette.
  5. Add to Canvas: Click the "Add to Canvas" button to place the color palette directly onto your Figma canvas.
  6. Add to Variables: Click the "Add to Variables" button to add the colors palette as Figma's variables.


Check out the article Building an Accessible Color System to learn more about creating and refining color palettes, and building an accessible color system out of it.


HCT Color Space:

HCT (Hue, Chroma, Tone) is a perceptually uniform color space developed by Google. It combines the CAM16 model for hue and chroma with the CIELAB (D65) color space's tone (lightness), ensuring consistent visual representation across hues. By converting complex contrast ratios into simple tonal differences, HCT makes it easy to meet accessibility standards—just select colors with enough tonal contrast!


Explore More on HCT:

  1. The Science Behind HCT and Color Design
  2. Handbook of Color Psychology
106201.tagline: Generate accessible color palettes instantly with HCT color space.

plugins.name: Blåkopi Plugin
plugins.description:
Export variables and text-styles from Figma into your SCSS codebase in the style and format that you want.

plugins.name: Relative changes
plugins.description:
Change multiple values of nodes that show "Mixed" in the GUI with custom calculations.


Select the nodes you want to change and apply the changes of your calculations.


  • It resolves the limitation of applying changes to nodes which have mixed property values.
  • It provides usable variables from the node's properties value. You can use the width of the node as a multiple in your changes.
  • It provides a way to apply changes to nodes in a group, without affecting those individual elements. You do not have to create a new group to modify the elements, since doing so would extract those nodes from their respective group(s).

11516.name: Relative changes
11516.description:

plugins.name: Sticky Notes
plugins.description:
A simple and intuitive plugin to add sticky notes to your Figma designs.


Key Features:

- Create sticky notes with custom text

- Choose from 6 vibrant colors (orange, salmon, blue, green, pink, and purple)

- Clean, minimal interface that matches Figma's design


Perfect for:

- Collecting feedback and comments

- Brainstorming sessions

- User flow annotations

- Team collaboration

- Design reviews

- Project planning


Simply type your note, pick a color, and create - the plugin handles all the styling to ensure your notes look great on any background.
plugins.tagline: Create colorful sticky notes in your Figma designs with ease

110202.name: Sticky Notes

plugins.name: Farcaster Frames
plugins.description:
You probably already design Farcaster Frames in Figma. This plugin allows you to create wholesome Frame experience without writing any code -- without leaving Figma!


Create decision driven comics, presentations, interactive memes, or anything you can imagine!


Each Figma Frame is a Farcaster Frame. You can add buttons and connect them together with Prototype flows. When you're ready to go, simply activate the plugin and the frame will deployed and ready to share in few seconds!
plugins.tagline: Create, design, and deploy your Frames without leaving Figma

106035.name: Farcaster Frames
106035.description:
You probably already design Farcaster Frames in Figma. This plugin allows you to create wholesome Frame experience without writing any code -- without leaving Figma!


Create decision driven comics, presentations, interactive memes, or anything you can imagine!


Each Figma Frame is a Farcaster Frame. You can add buttons and connect them together with Prototype flows. When you're ready to go, simply activate the plugin and the frame will deployed and ready to share in few seconds!
106035.release_notes: Attaching buttons to frames is now much easier. We also made sharing frame links easier to copy. All for your convenience 💜
106035.tagline: Create, design, and deploy your Frames without leaving Figma

plugins.name: Theme Swap
plugins.description:
Crie templates das suas features e rapidamente mude para o tema desejado.


  1. Crie os componentes com propriedade específicas de estilo/brand.
  2. Selecione os frames desejados e inicie o plugin.
  3. Escolha a propriedade desejada e alterne os valores chave.
  4. Feito! Você terá a replica dos seus designs com um tema distinto ✌️

plugins.name: Solo - Portrait Background Remove
plugins.description:
Remove Backgrounds from Images for Free

Using the latest in machine learning models, this tool allows you to select any Figma node, then remove the background from the foreground instantly and freely.


Simply.

  1. Select the Figma objects with images that you'd like to remove the background from
  2. Right click and run "solo" from the plugins menu
  3. Wait and in a few seconds your image will be ready and replaced.


Solo runs all image processing on-device in Figma, so your images are fully secure and never leave your device.


Note

As this plugin uses cutting edge machine learning models, it may not be compatible with all devices and browsers and will likely have variable results on images. Apologies in advance if it doesn't work for you!


I've found this model works best on people rather than foreground objects.
plugins.tagline: Remove background from any image in Figma for free and securely, on-device.

101955.name: Solo - Portrait Background Remove
101955.description:

Using the latest in machine learning models, this tool allows you to select any Figma node, then remove the background from the foreground instantly and freely.


Simply.

  1. Select the Figma objects with images that you'd like to remove the background from
  2. Right click and run "solo" from the plugins menu
  3. Wait and in a few seconds your image will be ready and replaced.


Solo runs all image processing on-device in Figma, so your images are fully secure and never leave your device.


Note

As this plugin uses cutting edge machine learning models, it may not be compatible with all devices and browsers and will likely have variable results on images. Apologies in advance if it doesn't work for you!


I've found this model works best on people rather than foreground objects.
101955.tagline: Remove background from any image in Figma for free and securely, on-device.

plugins.name: Figma-Clinch Exporter Plugin
plugins.description:
The Figma-Clinch Exporter Plugin enables designers to quickly and efficiently export their Figma designs for the purpose of creating ads within Flight Control, Clinch’s omnichannel campaign activation platform.


How it works: Using the plugin, Figma frames and fonts are exported to a ZIP file that can be seamlessly imported to Flight Control. Flight Control’s intuitive UI and creative authoring and mapping tools make it easy to then create HTML or Image ads enriched with dynamic functionalities.


Streamline your design workflows and build more effective ads, with the Figma-Clinch Exporter Plugin. Questions? Contact FigmaSupport@clinch.co
plugins.tagline: Export Figma designs. Upload to the Flight Control platform. Build great ads.

Streamline your design workflows and build more effective ads, with the Figma-Clinch Exporter Plugin. Questions? Contact FigmaSupport@clinch.co
122374.tagline: Export Figma designs. Upload to the Flight Control platform. Build great ads.
